intro: Gonzalezia, commonly known as the goldenbush, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It consists of several species, primarily found in South America, particularly in Brazil and Paraguay. The plants are shrubs or small trees with lance-shaped leaves and showy yellow or orange flowers. They are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in various soil conditions. Gonzalezia species are also valued for their ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
